abstract: Closing the Cordis division in the face of dwindling market share, the company expects to trim 900 to 1,000 jobs this year.
snippet: Closing the Cordis division in the face of dwindling market share, the company expects to trim 900 to 1,000 jobs this year.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson announced on Wednesday that it would stop manufacturing drug-coated heart stents by the end of the year, abandoning an intensely competitive $4 billion market after a series of setbacks for the company and rising concerns about the use of stents in some patients.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson to End Line of Drug-Coated Heart Stents
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson to End Line of Drug-Coated Heart Stents
